title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.41 | 18-10-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananj Nishalakaya
Chakcharun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pachatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Devim Saraswateem
Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 41st verse of the 13th chapter of the 1st canto of Shri Madbhagavatam
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Narada Vacha Ma Kanchana Shucho Rajan Yadishvara Vasham Jagat
Loka Sapala Yasyeme Vahanti Balim Eeshituhu
Sa Samyunakti Bhutani Sa Eva Vinuyak Viyunakti Cha
The meaning of this verse is
Shri Narada said, O pious king, do not lament for anyone, for everyone is under the control of the Supreme Lord.
Therefore, all living beings.
And their leaders carry on worship to be well protected.
It is he only who brings them together and disperses them.
So, Shri La Pravapada explains this very important point in the purport elaborately.
What Narada Muni is telling as a reply to Yudhishthira.
Yudhishthira is concerned, where are my uncles and aunt gone?
So, Narada before directly telling where have they gone?
He is first explaining the general principle, which all of us have to understand.
Every living being either in this material world or in the spiritual world is under the control of the Supreme Lord, the Personality of Godhead.
Now, why is Krishna called the Supreme Lord?
Because Lord means controller.
And Supreme means he is the ultimate controller of everyone.
So, he is...
He is completely controlling everyone in the material world and in the spiritual world.
Universally, everywhere he is controlled.
And Pravapada further clarifies this.
Beginning from Brahmaji, the leader of this universe, down to the insignificant and all are abiding by the order of the Supreme Lord.
Brahma is the first created being in this universe.

There are millions of universes, sorry, there are millions of planets in each universe, and in each planet there are millions of living entities, all of them beginning from Brahma, the topmost in this living being in this universe, and down to the most insignificant creature, everyone is abiding by the order of the Supreme Lord.
The Supreme Lord's control is everywhere.
And when it is said everyone is abiding by the order, not everyone is abiding by the order of the Lord voluntarily.

It is only the devotees and the pious people, the followers of the Vedic injunctions or the scriptural directions given by God, only they are actually voluntarily following the order of the Supreme Lord.
The others, demons, atheists, and agnostics, materialists, rebellious souls, all of them are forced to obey the order of the Supreme Lord.
Thus, the constitutional position of the living being is subordination under the control of the Lord.
Everyone is subordinate to the Lord.
The Lord is the only supreme personality.
He is the supreme master.
Everyone is under his control.
Ekala, Ishvara, Krishna are Sababhrithya.
This is explained in the Chaitanya Charitamatha.
Krishna is the only Ishvara, only control, ultimately.
And everyone else is under his control.
Constitutional position means the way we are made, the way we are constituted, the way we are eternally,
is that we're subordinate.
